isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE SPEED AXLES: SPICER D135-S, F155-S, F170-S SERIES - INSTALL - CARRIER ASSEMBLY INTO AXLE HOUSING

step1.para: Thoroughly clean the inside of the axle housing and inspect the housing mounting surface for nicks and general cleanliness. Stone the surface if necessary to remove burrs or nicks.
Apply a 1/8 inch bead of Loctite 518 gasket eliminator onto the axle housing mounting flange and around each bolt hole ( Figure 73).
Thread 2 studs into housing 180° apart to aid installation of the carrier assembly. This will also eliminate rotating carrier assembly after it is in contact with the gasket material.

Install carrier into housing. Clean mounting bolts, coat with Loctite #277 or equivalent, and install. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICANTS AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Tighten evenly in a cross pattern. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Allow one hour cure time for gasket material before adding hypoid lubricant.
Remove old axle flange gasket and clean mating surfaces of hub and axle flange.

note.para: If gasket is not available, apply a 1/4 inch bead of RTV gasket material on mating surface of axle flange and an additional bead around each hole.

step1.para: Install axle shaft. Refer to the TORQUE CHART, for proper torque specifications of axle flange nuts.
Clean and install drain plug. Fill unit to proper level with hypoid gear lubricant.
